intro: Tanacetum trifurcatum, commonly known as the three-branched tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellowish-green flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its essential oils contain compounds like thymol and camphor, which contribute to its medicinal and aromatic properties.
